title: Margarita Cake Recipe
description: This margarita cake made with cake mix, tequila, lime juice, and triple sec is finished with a margarita-flavored glaze for a fabulous celebration cake!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Margarita Cake 4.7 (416) 351 Reviews 73 Photos This margarita cake is easy to make with cake mix, vanilla pudding, tequila, lime juice, and triple sec. The cake is topped with a margarita-flavored glaze for a fabulous celebration cake. Submitted by Carol Updated on March 14, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 73 73 73 73 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 10-inch bundt cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 (18.25 ounce) package orange cake mix 1 (3.4 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix 4 eggs ½ cup vegetable oil ⅔ cup water ¼ cup lemon juice ¼ cup tequila 2 tablespoons triple sec liqueur 1 cup confectioners' sugar 1 tablespoon tequila 2 tablespoons triple sec liqueur 2 tablespoons lime juice Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10-inch Bundt pan. To make the cake: Combine cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, oil, water, lemon juice, 1/4 cup tequila and 2 tablespoons triple sec in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 45 to 50 minutes. Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack while you make the glaze. To make the glaze: Combine confectioners' sugar, 1 tablespoon tequila, 2 tablespoons triple sec, and 2 tablespoons lime juice in a small bowl; mix until smooth. Pour glaze over cake while still warm. I Made It Print 473 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Margarita Cake 01 of 73 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 73 Photo by  Nancy Grzymko 12/28/2024 Great flavors Delicious. I made double the icing, used fresh squeezed lime juice not lemon juice. Used two round cake pans, put icing between layers. Also brushed each layer with Triple Sec. Fabulous! 03 of 73 Photo by  Jamikia Oglesby 10/26/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Worth the effort Family favorite Strawberry margarita cake 04 of 73 Photo by  KindSieve1528 01/24/2024 I made this cake with duck eggs, because I was given a couple and wanted to use them in a cake. It took me a while but I did find orange cake mix at a Woolworths (not all of them stock it). I couldn't find pudding mix anywhere though, so I used a panna cotta mix that I got at an Asian grocer. I used the icing mix that came with the orange cake and added coconut flavoured tequila blanco and Cointreau. I didn't have a bunt cake tin, so just used a square one I had. It turned out great! It did remind me of a margarita and it was dense by fluffy. 05 of 73 Photo by  Jaime Briseno 03/06/2022 This recipe was very easy to make however i did make a change. I mixed a 1.5 jigger of tequila and triple sec along with the juice of one lime and poured over cake while it was still in the pan. 15 minutes took cake out from pan a prepared glaze. Also made a margarita on the rocks and placed drink in the middle of the cake. Guest loved it!!! 06 of 73 Photo by  Furaha Linda 02/02/2022 Easy to make. Delicious and moist. Considering cakes not extremely high in calories. Loved it! 07 of 73 Photo by  ndominique70 09/12/2021 I put my own little spin on the recipe and everybody loved it . Thank you!! 08 of 73 Photo by  Vanessa Sneed 04/07/2021 I made mini-bundt cakes for a coworker's birthday. Due to Covid, I've been taking individual serving sizes to the office instead of traditional sized bakery items. I topped with candied limes, oranges and lemon wedges for a little extra pop. I replaced the lemon and lime juice with key lime juice. I agree with others that next time I will make the icing a little thicker. I always try to find an orange cake mix. It takes some extra effort to locate, but I think it compliments the triple sac and tequila the best. 09 of 73 Photo by  Kathy 03/28/2021 Fabulous cake -- very moist. Like others, I couldn't find an orange cake mix, so used a lemon cake and substituted a combination of orange and lemon juice for the water and a tablespoon of orange oil. I agree that I'm not sure the tequila added much and will probably opt for using a margarita mix next time in place of it. I doubled the glaze, poked holes in the warm cake, and poured one recipe of glaze over the bottom while the cake was still in the pan; then added extra sifted powdered sugar to get the glaze to the consistency I wanted before drizzling it over the cake in three passes -- one while warm; one about 30 minutes later; and the last about an hour later. Very citrus-y and yummy. (The picture I added is after three days -- still moist and tasty!) 10 of 73 Photo by  Juanita Ventura 08/26/2020 This cake was a huge hit! I made some changes, however. Are used white cake mix, and I added one small box of lime Jell-O. I increase the water from 2/3 to 1 cup, and added an extra tablespoon of tequila to the cake mix. When I make this cake again, I will probably add an extra egg, as well. I made some changes, however. I used white cake mix, and I added one small box of lime Jell-O. I increase the water from 2/3 to one cup, and add an extra tablespoon of tequila to the cake mix. When I make this cake again, I will probably add an extra egg, as well. When the cake came out, I drizzle tequila on the bottom of it, since I used a Bundt cake pan. I would probably double the glaze and add the glaze to the pod bottom next time. As far as the glaze, I decrease the amount of lime juice, because it’s otherwise too thin. Alternatively, you could increase the amount of sugar but I’m not a fan of sugar. Once glazed, topped the cake with lime zest and rocksalt/margarita salt. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Margarita Tube Cake 7 Ratings Raspberry Tiramisu 44 Ratings Frozen Margarita Pie 53 Ratings Blueberry Upside-Down Cake 41 Ratings Lemon Souffle Cheesecake with Blueberry Topping 127 Ratings Blueberry Cream Cheese Pound Cake I 345 Ratings Blueberry Dump Cake 439 Ratings Swedish Cream with Summer Berries 40 Ratings Chocolate Orange Marble Cake 28 Ratings No-Bake Chocolate Yule Log with Chocolate Mushrooms 7 Ratings Simple Chocolate Strawberry Shortcake 12 Ratings Rainbow Citrus Cake 78 Ratings Acini di Pepe Salad 133 Ratings Key Lime Cake 338 Ratings Lemon Glazed Cake 176 Ratings Blueberry Pound Cake 482 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Carol
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10-inch Bundt pan.;To make the cake: Combine cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, oil, water, lemon juice, 1/4 cup tequila and 2 tablespoons triple sec in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes.;Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 45 to 50 minutes. Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack while you make the glaze.;To make the glaze: Combine confectioners' sugar, 1 tablespoon tequila, 2 tablespoons triple sec, and 2 tablespoons lime juice in a small bowl; mix until smooth. Pour glaze over cake while still warm.
